Changing Chart Element Colors

Using the Windows client (and depending upon the chart), you can change the color used for:

  • Background of the chart

  • Bars, in bar charts.

  • Points, in charts with points.

  • Areas, in area charts.

  • Slices, in pie and doughnut charts. Color is set per slice in these charts, because each slice is considered a series and requires its own color.

If you feel limited by the current selection of colors, you can even design your own. See Customizing the Palette Bar.

Using the Cross-Platform client, you can Edit the colors of your series data only.

The options for both clients are described in the sections below.

Using the Windows Client to Change Chart Element Colors

To change the colors of chart elements from the Palette Bar:

  1. If the Palette Bar is not already displayed, click the Tools button on the Chart window toolbar. Then select PaletteBar from the menu.

  2. If the window is not wide enough to display the complete Palette Bar, use the arrows to scroll through the colors.

  3. From the Palette Bar, drag a color to a chart element. This action applies the color to the chart element.

To change the colors of chart elements from the Chart window toolbar:

  1. Click Change Color on the Chart window toolbar to display the available colors.

  2. Click the new color to be used. This color appears as the selected color on the button.

  3. Drag the color from the button to the location in the chart to which it will be applied.

Using the Cross-Platform Client to Change Series Data Colors

To change the colors of series data from the Chart window toolbar:

  1. Click Edit Colors on the Chart window toolbar. The Edit Colors dialog opens.

  2. Check Use Custom Colors.

  3. Select a series from the list, and click Edit. You can edit one series at a time. The Select Color dialog opens.

  4. Using the tabs at the top of the Select Color dialog, you can choose your own custom color for the selected series. You can choose from swatches, HSB, or RGB colors. Make you desired selection, and click OK to exit the Select Color dialog.

  5. In the Edit Colors dialog, you can select another series to edit its color, or click OK to apply your changes and exit the Edit Colors dialog.
